CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 17, 1954, page 8 reads: "A Soap Sales Expert Briefs His Crew - When James A. Otterson (shown standing), now executive secretary at the Homewood YMCA, was in charge of the Hill-Top YMCA in Beltzhoover last year, one of the boys who is a member there, young Calvin Jones, shown with pencil and paper at the head of the table, entered a contest to sell soap to obtain funds to go to camp and to the surprise of everyone sold over 2,000 cakes. When Mr. Otterson became the head at the Homewood YMCA this year, he invited Calvin Jones of 340 Sylvania Street over to plan the soap-sale-for-camp-funds drive among the Homewood boys. Reading clockwise around the table are Gerald Carter, 7020 Frankstown Avenue; Robert Wieland, 8159 Conemaugh Street; Calvin Jones; Mr. Otterson; John R. Drake, 716 Sterrett Street, and John Fisher, 7802 Hamilton Avenue. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: James A. Otterson standing over six boys, including five seated left to right: Gerald Carter, Robert James, Calvin Jones, Robert Wieland, and John R. Drake, gathered around table with Specialty Salesman magazine for soap sales drive, in Homewood YMCA
